content.description:
This ascends an arete like feature to the right of Glutton For Punishment.

Pitch #1: Start up the obvious arete and follow the widely spaced bolts. Go through the roof where the crux is encountered and the protection is good. A shared two-bolt belay with GFP. 5.9+, 30m.

Rappel the route or walk off.
content.protection: QDs for 5 bolts. Two holes for Removable Bolts or a small rack of Nuts and Camalots should be adequate for protecting this pitch.
content.location: North side of Millicent -Wolverine Saddle in granite.

content.description:
A Sport Climb in an alpine arena. The latin name for Wolverine translates to The Glutton.

Pitch #1: Climb up a ramp clipping the first of 9 bolts to the top of the buttress and a two bolt belay ledge.

Rappel the route back into the couloir or walk off.
content.protection: QDs for 9 bolts. Some climbers may prefer to carry a few small Camalots.
content.location: This is a rock climb located on the north side of the Millicent - Wolverine Saddle. The start is about 100m down the couloir (not so steep). If the Millicent Lift is running, the approach time is quite short.
